title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal in Team USA's win over Denmark during the preliminary round of the Olympics.
Swayman humorously responded to mishap, dismissing concerns about visibility issues by joking about being colorblind.
Despite allowing two regrettable goals, Swayman made 18 saves and Team USA won sufficiently against Denmark.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum is nearing a return from an Achilles injury, potentially impacting the Celtics' playoff run.
Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony express optimism about Tatum's All-Star level play upon return.
Tatum has been practicing with the Celtics' G League affiliate as he progresses in his rehab.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots have $41 million in cap space for offseason signings, per Over The Cap analysis.
Colts WR Alec Pierce is a top target due to his high yards per reception; he's turning 26 in May.
Packers OT Rasheed Walker, Bills C Connor McGovern, Ravens TE Isaiah Likely, and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips are potential free agency fits.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN is now MLB.TV's streaming platform, with MLB.TV available as an add-on for ESPN Unlimited subscribers.
ESPN Unlimited subscribers can purchase MLB.TV for $134.99; non-subscribers pay $149.99, including a free month's trial of ESPN.
Existing MLB.TV users automatically renew their subscriptions, with ESPN Unlimited trial optional for these subscribers.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a G League practice with the Maine Celtics, sparking speculation about his potential return.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement but offered no confirmation on Tatum's return this season.
Tatum continues to be ruled out in Celtics' injury reports as he recovers from an Achilles tear sustained last May.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the U.S. according to WalletHub's 2026 analysis.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, and nearly 22% have a graduate or professional degree.
Vermont and Maryland ranked second and third, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia were at the bottom.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: The rare Honus Wagner T206 baseball card, featured on Netflix’s ‘King of Collectibles,’ is up for auction until February 21.
The card was originally pulled by Morton Bernstein in the early 1900s and is being sold by his grandsons.
Current bid for the ungraded Wagner card is $3.9 million, with a possible sale price of $4,758,000 including buyer's premium.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman, 27, will start for Team USA in Saturday's Olympic matchup against Denmark in his first Olympic appearance.
Swayman previously helped Team USA win the 2025 IIHF World Championship, recording a 5-0 record and a shutout in the final.
Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy will also play for Team USA, starting in a top pairing with Quinn Hughes against Denmark.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: New England Aquarium identified a dead North Atlantic right whale off Virginia as a 3-year-old female.
The whale was the 2023 calf of right whale #3293 'Porcia,' marking the second right whale death in two weeks.
Scientists at NOAA will conduct a necropsy; this death is part of an ongoing right whale mortality event since 2017.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Seven children have died from the flu in Massachusetts this season, as reported by the Department of Public Health.
A total of 260 flu-related deaths, including seven pediatric, have occurred in Massachusetts during the current flu season.
Massachusetts public health officials urge vaccinations amid high flu activity, especially for vulnerable groups like children and older adults.
